bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Howard A. Kelly, January 11, 1903

div1.p: Kean solicits support for pension bills in Congress. He discusses biographical essays on Walter Reed by himself and Kelly.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Howard A. Kelly, January 11, 1903
div1.opener:
Dr. Latimer
Expect to get up
an editorial.
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
Jan 11th 1903
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
WASHINGTON.
Dr Howard O. Kelly
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Doctor
div1.p:
Knowing that you
are interested in the matter
of an adequate pension for
the family of Dr Walter
Reed I write to put you
au courant of the matter-
A bill has been introduced
into Congress by Senator
Martin of Va. & Mr Hay of
Va. to give Mrs Reed a
pension of $4000 a year-
It is thought by Dr Reeds
C1
B2
2-
friends that it should be
a national recognition of
a national benefit received,
and so should not be
niggardly or inadequate
for the decent support of
his family- The amount
asked for is $1000 less than
is given to the widows of
ex-Presidents-

It is however highly proba-
ble that it will be greatly
cut down in Committee
unless the prominent men
in the profession came
forward and demand
the full amount- Any
thing you will feel inclined
to do in this matter will
be most timely and help-
ful- If a strong editorial
in an important daily
paper would be elicited
in addition to letters to
congressmen it would help
greatly- In this matter for
obvious reasons it is desirable
for the Surgeon Generals
Office not to take too
prominent a part and so
I will ask you not to quote
this letter outside of profes-
sional circles-

I have quite an accumulation
of matter with reference to
Dr Reed which I have been
using in the preparation of
a sketch of his life & work
to be laid before the Senate
Committee- Mrs Reed writes
me that you are preparing
a short biography of him
and it is possible that
some of their material may
be of value to you, as will
also the addresses given
at the memorial meeting
held by the Medical Society
here in Dec 31st- If you
desire them I will be glad
to send them to you-
